verses.roman:
namo 'stu te mahā-yogin
prapannam anuśādhi mām
yathā tvac-caraṇāmbhoje
ratiḥ syād anapāyinī

synonyms: namaḥ astu—let me offer my obeisances; te—unto You; mahā-yogin—O greatest of mystics; prapannam—who am surrendered; anuśādhi—please instruct; mām—me; yathā—how; tvat—Your; caraṇa-ambhoje—at the lotus feet; ratiḥ—transcendental attraction; syāt—may be; anapāyinī—undeviating.
translation: Obeisances unto You, O greatest of yogīs. Please instruct me, who am surrendered unto You, how I may have undeviating attachment to Your lotus feet.
